text: The ground suddenly trembles as a beast covered in rocky armor bursts from the earth. Its eyes glow green, and its roar sends birds scattering through the forest.
I roll sharply to the side, gravel crunching beneath my boots. The beast’s claws sweep past where I stood, striking sparks as they graze the stones.
My breath turns cold in my lungs. The moment I regain my footing, Alicia’s figure flashes forward. Her cloak arcs through the wind, and her blade follows in a streak of light.
A flash of silver forces the beast back several steps. A hoarse growl rattles from its throat.
Spotting an opening, I shout, “Right side—its shell is cracked!”
“I see it.” Her voice remains steady, her movement precise. The blade arcs smoothly, carving a cold line through the air.
The beast falters. The green light in its eyes flickers out. Its body stiffens before crashing to the ground, shattered armor scattering dust.
The air fills with the smell of scorched earth and smoke. Alicia sheaths her sword and turns toward me.
“Good reflexes.” She says calmly, though a faint smile curves her lips. “Next time, don’t stand so close.”
I nod, my palms slick with cold sweat, yet a strange thrill rises in my chest—I survived, and I helped.
Blackened marks from the burning creature scar the ground. Sunlight filters through the branches, striking her blade with an icy gleam.
“These creatures aren’t natural,” she says quietly. “They’re ‘Lingering Dreams’—traces left behind by the dead.”
“Lingering Dreams?” I repeat, my voice still unsteady.
“Yes. In places where battles were fought and lives were lost, their final emotions sink into the earth. Over time, they become things like this.”
She settles her sword at her side, her expression returning to calm. The wind sweeps through the trees, carrying away the scent of blood.
“Come on. The market’s just ahead.” She smiles lightly. “I’ll be counting on you to carry a few things.”
